conclusion: To determine if the puppy is safe, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided and the given conditions.
The initial velocity of the coach bus is 20 m/s as shown in the graph.
The distance the coach bus travels before coming to a stop can be determined by analyzing the velocity-time graph.
The velocity decreases linearly from 20 m/s to 0 m/s over time, so the distance covered is given by the area under the velocity-time graph.
The area under the graph from 0 to 20 m/s can be calculated as the integral of velocity over time.
The distance covered is calculated as: Distance = ∫(0 to 20) v dt = ∫(0 to 20) 20 dt = 20 × 20 = 400 m.
The puppy is initially 45 m away from the coach bus.
The distance the coach bus travels before coming to a stop is calculated as 400 m - 45 m = 355 m.
Determine if the distance covered by the coach bus before coming to a stop is less than the distance from the puppy to the coach bus.
Since 355 m is less than 45 m, the puppy is safe.
The final answer is: Yes, the puppy is safe.
